intro: Swertia japonica f. chionantha, commonly known as the snow-flower gentian, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
